title: Introduction
text:
The idea is this …
There would be pre-written code, with explanations of what it does. Fellows would work through this notebook, running pre-written code and adding new code of their own in mini “on your own” quests.
They can Render the page as we go along to see how that works.
Practice is in a different notebook.

title: Introduction
text:
Libraries
Talk about them. This is fenced to show the chunk options.

```{r}
#| label: setup
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
```







Important



There is no OYO for setting up libraries since we don’t want to do it twice in the same notebook..

title: Introduction
text:
Importing
A lot of talk about how this works …

tx <- read_csv("data-raw/tx.csv") |> clean_names()

Rows: 94475 Columns: 10

date (1): DATE
